name: Erection of the Schwarzenberg Monument
obverse: Busts of Alexander I of Russia, Francis II of the Holy Roman Empire, and Friedrich Wilhelm III of Prussia facing left. Below the busts, a crown enclosed by a wreath and flanked by a cannon, a spear, and two banners. There is a broken chain below the crown, symbolizing the end of France’s reign.
obverse_inscriptions: GOTT WAR MIT IHNEN. ZUM XXV. IUBILAEUM DER SCHLACHT BEI LEIPZIG
reverse: Image of the monument honoring the princes of Schwarzenberg erected in Wachau. A sword and wreath lay on the tomb.
references: Beschreibung der Bisher bekannten böhmischen Privatmünzen und Medaillen #529
Die Paul Henckel'sche Sammlung brandenburg-preussischer Munzen und Medaillen #2386
Münzen- und Medaillen-Sammlung in der Marienburg #3838
description: This medal commemorates the erection of the Schwarzenberg Monument in Meusdorf, Leipzig.

This medal is uncommon and does not have much information about it. I do not know who EHR refers to, but the Biographical Dictionary of Medallists volume 5 states that Ludwig Schreck directed the creation of this medal.
